metadata.Title: CVE-2020-10933 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description: An issue was discovered in Ruby 2.5.x through 2.5.7, 2.6.x through 2.6.5, and 2.7.0. If a victim calls BasicSocket#read_nonblock(requested_size, buffer, exception: false), the method resizes the buffer to fit the requested size, but no data is copied. Thus, the buffer string provides the previous value of the heap. This may expose possibly sensitive data from the interpreter.

criterions.comment: ruby1.9.1: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
ruby2.0: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
